title: Has anybody else just, ceased getting excited for new champions?
body:
Every time my thoughts are "It is either going to be an attempt to be excessively unique and/or be busted as fuck on release(or with post release buffs), then will drop off the face of the earth and nobody will give a fuck about it."

I personally am more in favor of new maps/map skins, reworks and features. And the last time I felt excited about a new champion was two years ago. They all either end up like Aurelion, so 'unique' they are never played. Or like Camille, so overloaded they break the game.

Plus Riot no longer ever just releases 'generic' champions. One of the best things about generic champions is I can go "I feel like being an arcane wizard today. And Riot has one!" Nowadays if Riot released an arcane wizard it would have seven fingers on one hand, one wing sticking off it's opposite side and use a sword to cast arrows at enemies. Just to be 'unique'. Then would have a million fucking tools in it's kit.

I say this because I saw the new teaser image but instead of going "CANNOT WAIT to see what the new champion is!" I got flashbacks to bullshit like Ivern.

Maybe I am just alone in this.

R: Cosmic Eruption

Lu'Kath calls upon the mist of the shadow isles, covering  jungle camps which are currently available to be taken. Upon going and clearing all camps that are marked, Lu'Kath's next basic attack against champions will be empowered, dealing bonus damage equal to 30% of his AD, plus 30% of his AP, plus the square root of his total health and mana. Upon successfully landing the empowered basic attack on an enemy, all of Lu'Kath's cooldowns are reduced by 10%.

Additionally, if this empowered basic attack kills the target champion, any allies that received gold for assisting on that kill will grant Lu'Kath bonus Armor and MR equal to 5% of their respective resistances. Also, for every champion that assisted with the previously mentioned kill, a satellite will be launched into orbit around runeterra. Periodically throughout the game (5 minutes, reduced by CDR), these satellites will locate places where various item components can be found scattered across summoner's rift. By going to these locations, which will be marked on the minimap, you can collect these components. These components can be sold or kept, as normal. If Lu'Kath's inventory is full, he will instead be granted XP.

If Lu'Kath levels up from the XP gained from picking up an item uncovered by the satellite which was launched when your allies scored an assist on the kill you got with your empowered basic attack, then he gains a stack. At 5 stacks, Lu'Kath's basic abilities will passively grant him stacks of Mist. Upon reaching three stacks of Mist, the stacks reset to 0, and Lu'Kath gains 0.5 seconds of invisibility. For every unit killed before the invisibility timer runs out, Lu'Kath gains a stack of Independence. At 50 stacks (scaling with the number of states in the USA), the stacks of Independence will automatically jump to 1,776. At 1,776 stacks of Independence, Lu'Kath gains **_Freedom Fighter_**

**_Freedom Fighter_**: 5 seconds after being spotted by an enemy champion, any enemy champion within 1000 units of Lu'Kath are forced to stop and salute at the American Flag, which will be flown over Summoner's Rift by 5 jet planes. During this time, they cannot move or cast abilities, and their vision is locked to whichever direction they are facing, but the visuals are slightly blurred, as they are looking at the American Flag, and therefore can only see parts of Summoner's Rift out of their peripheral vision.

The American Flag has a chance of falling to Summoner's Rift and covering it completely, based on Lu'Kath's critical strike chance. If this event occurs, the minions of the side allied to Lu'Kath will be turned into American Marines. American Marines are champions, but coded with special AI equivalent to Mordekaiser's Dragon Ghost, and therefore will not obey any of your commands, because they don't take shit from anyone. Despite being champions, however, they are coded as minions, and will grant gold for the Bandit mastery, any of the Gold Generation items, and from Azir Ult.

If a Marine kills an enemy champion, that champion gains a stack of Freedom. At three stacks, the US military invades their respective homelands, freeing the people from the Commies. Upon the time that freedom is delivered, that champion's cooldowns will only go down by spamming emotes. However, if the emote spam isn't entertaining in any way, that ability corresponding to that emote will not have its cooldown refunded, and that champion will be forced to go without that ability for the rest of the game.

_Upon killing the enemy nexus (because Freedom is inescapable), an American flag drops out of the sky to land the final blow on the Nexus, granting 50 gold. to America Additionally, instead of "Victory," "Freedom" will be the end-game screen, and a screenshot will automatically be taken and made your desktop background. 'Cause 'Murica._

Rito isn't willing to fix the champions they already have and they intentionally drop new ones they know matter-of-factly will crowd out older picks even further.  They purposefully keep specific champions in perpetual states of unplayability or mediocrity for the luckier ones...

Their excuse?  "New champion design and champion reworks are 2 separate departments.  We can't reallocate employees from one to work on the other."  No Rito, that's exactly what you can fucking do.  However, that's not even the issue.  The problem is that Rito just very clearly do not want to balance the game, they make selfish changes.  They don't even try to hide their own bias when people like Meddler are allowed to come here onto the forums and publicly declare that a specific nerf is their own personal idea that they didn't bother discussing with the rest of the team.  As far as Meddler is concerned, his IS the whole team.

That's kind of blatantly false.

We've had several class reworks aimed specifically at old/outdated champions to bring them up. Regardless of balance or gameplay preference, Riot DOES notice them. On top of that, we've had both large-scale updates like Ryze, Sion, Galio, Taric, Poppy, Gangplank and Warwick alongside smaller-scale reworks like Fiora, Shen, Miss Fortune and Shyvana. If you were right, they'd just retire or icebox these champs for the rest of League's lifespan and write them off as hall-of-famers.

And Meddler personally stated that all of those class reworks have been overall failures.  With the odd successes, which are usually only to champions that were already playable, the majority ended up worse off from a balance perspective.  Most ended up either weaker or with a less-healthy kit that's more difficult to balance.

Besides, you're purposefully misinterpreting Emmy's post, she didn't say Rito is ignoring old champs.  She said Rito is intentionally keeping old champs weak, which is the opposite of ignoring a problem.  It's the realization that a problem exists and the action & decision of continue keeping it as a problem

Inaction is a type of action.  A crime by omission is equivalent to a crime by acting.

Nah you're not totally alone, lots of people feel this way. While I like some aspects of Ivern in particular, I hate all these "more than human" Champions. Ivern is an ancient tree guy, Aurelion is a space dragon, Kled is in every Noxian war in history for some reason (makes me worry what the heck they are doing to Yordles...)

These days, I barely have time for League so I stick to my core champions when I get the chance to play. I get more excited about lore implications and expansions relating to new Champions. Camille was cool for me because of her role in Piltovian society and her possible connection to other Champions. Back in the day I called the release of both Sejuani and Lissandra based on the lore alone (ah, I miss you JoJ). That was a really cool feeling to read about this important character in history and then get to play them. We need more of these alluded to Champions, like Irelia's brother or Kassadin's daughter or Kog's daddy. 

That said, this is also the reason I find reworks more exciting. A fresh take on an old favorite, with lore expansion to boot. (Can't wait to see Urgot!)
